channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Gas cannisters dumped, 28th October
item.description:
Lots of fast gas cannisters have been dumped in the (public) park entrance on Rowley Avenue, nearest to the junction with Harcourt Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Rowley Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish/filthy Street. Can we please have Ceres Road cleaned. It is becoming a hazard with the amount of rubbish littering the road. It is an eyesore. Street has not been cleaned for months., 28th October
item.description:
Large amount of dumped rubbish blocking pavement causing hazards.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti all over Austin’s court, 28th October
item.description:
This was reported to the police on 28/10/2025 as the individual accessed the roof. Also included previous tagging on the wall of 20 Austin’s Court

item.title: Litter near the stairs causing problem for the childrens and due to which residence are facing pest issue, 27th October
item.description:
There is rubish near the start of the stairs due to which it is difficult for children to walk through and resident are not even able to take toddlers down. It is a life treating situation for children as there os danger of them falling down and creating pest issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springfield Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temp lights, 27th October
item.description:
All out. Very dangerous.

item.title: Lamp, 27th October
item.description:
Lamp out in alley 34 now dark at 5.25 pm this is a dangerous place to be in the dark. And alley yet again is in disrepair

item.title: Roadwork Barriers Left, 27th October
item.description:
There are a number of roadwork barriers left propped up against the wall between 33 & 35 Days Lane. They have been there for a while now so not sure if they have been left in error or someone has moved them from somewhere else.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Days Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London

item.title: Flytipped cardboard posters at the start of kellett road, 27th October
item.description:
As you can see from the photos someone flytipped lots of cardboard posters (happened on the weekend) all over the street. Nearly fell having slipped on one coming back home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kellett Road, Brixton, London

item.title: Nelson Road N9, 27th October
item.description:
Tree recently cut done here but stump left this is attracting flytipped rubbish here even more if the stump was removed it won't be as attractive place to dump rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nelson Road, London

item.title: Flytipping, 27th October
item.description:
Flytipping outside the entrance of Barrowfield allotments on Colthurst Drive N9 and by Haynes Drive N9 always rubbish flytipped here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colthurst Drive, Edmonton, London

item.title: Tree outside number 48 Wellington Avenue N9, 27th October
item.description:
This tree has not flowered again this year it does look like it is dying, but there has been some movement in the recent windy weather at the bottom and us residents are worried it will fall over the next time we have really windy weather.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post with footpath sign, 27th October
item.description:
Recently the council came out to fix this footpath sign pole that was clearly leaning it was not fixed in a good position above tree roots that is clearly pushing it out the ground this is in-between number 46 and 48 Wellington Avenue N9. Please sort this out into a better location so it won't fall over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kitchen worktop and other rubbish dumped on street, 27th October
item.description:
Kitchen worktop, cupboards and other rubbish dumped and blocking pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fairholt Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bricks dumped in street and council is doing nothing, 27th October
item.description:
The same issue was reported around 6 weeks ago and multiple times since then and is consistently being ignored by the council - why? This waste is blocking the road, making it difficult for cars to pass each other and blocking a parking space. I am happy to keep on reporting the issue until it is properly resolved.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 outside Lairdale Estate about te, 27th October
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 outside Lairdale Estate about ten yards south of streetlight column ID number 74 is green power coated metal Lambeth cycle locker which is graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor re attached picture (which shows main double entrance gates for Rosendale Primary School entrance in the back ground and Google Streetview link which shows location but not the cycle locker as this is new: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4461252,-0.0988552,3a,60y,207.12h,87.69t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1s-trRssjvF9WQo3HFszR8zA!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D2.3071086706237196%26panoid%3D-trRssjvF9WQo3HFszR8zA%26yaw%3D207.116856745347!7i13312!8i6656?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTAyMi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coaldale Walk, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
